label: 白隠慧鶴
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1685-1768) Revitalizing the traditional Zen discipline based on zazen (meditation) and the use of kōan, Hakuin established the approach [to carry the teacings of Zen to the general population] that has characterized Rinzai Zen from the latter part of the arly modern period to modern times (p. 415). [座禅、公案、臨済宗]
